page.title: 03MENDIP PLATEAU-FARMING TYPES
page.content: This rugged area has a mixture of land uses-mainly agricultural. Its gently undulating landscape and rapidly draining limestone encourage crop growing, mainly wheat,barley & oats. Peas & oil seed rape, which restore nitrogen to the soil, appear in rotation systems. High winds make short stemmed varieties of cereals popular and spraying is needed against mildew because of the high rainfall. Sheep farming & beef cattle, are found in areas with thin soils or steeper slopes. Some dairy farming occurs on poorly drained areas, notably on a narrow outcrop of shale. Pig farming is also found on the plateau. The farming landscape and farming methods have changed a lot in recent times.
